Consider the power series
$\displaystyle \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{(-1)^n(x+2)^n}{\sqrt{n}}$, where
$\displaystyle x$ is a real number. Find the interval of convergence of
this series.
hints: Start by finding the radius of convergence.
Use the Ratio Test to calculate the radius of convergence.
Remember to check the endpoints of the interval!
